description: The Perfect Focus System (PFS) maintains the distance between the objective and the sample using real-time optical correction to keep the sample in focus. This post provides some detail on how to implement it within time-lapse and multi XY position imaging experiments using JOBs.

description: A method for moving the angle of the TIRF illuminator as the Z-stack transitions from top to bottom.  TIRF angles are set by the user at the top and bottom of the z-stack before acquisition, and the JOB lineraly interpoloates the TIRF angle for each z step.
